Title:
Globisporangium cryptosplendens sp. nov., a new species
separated from G. splendens
Abstract:
Globisporangium splendens is a major plant pathogenic
oomycete distributing worldwide. Based on nucleotide sequences of the
rDNA ITS region and mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase 1 and 2 gene, a
taxonomic group was segregated from G. splendens. This new taxonomic
group had no evident difference compared to G. splendens on morphology
and virulence on host plants. However, the phylogenetic variation was
comparable as the species-level in the molecular taxonomy. In order to
avoid confusion regarding the molecular identification, we taxonomically
characterized the phylogenetic group and proposed it as a new species
named G. cryptosplendens.
